title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 1 | Adult Quiz (25Q)

questions.prompt: 1. SB 1.1.1 begins with a meditation upon whom?
choices: Lord Sri Krishna, son of Vasudeva
questions.feedback: The chapter opens by offering obeisances and meditating upon Lord Sri Krishna, son of Vasudeva, as the Absolute Truth.

questions.prompt: 2. In SB 1.1.1, the Absolute Truth is described as the primeval cause of which three stages of the universe?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.1 identifies the Absolute Truth as the primeval cause of creation, sustenance, and destruction of the manifested universes.

questions.prompt: 3. According to SB 1.1.1, who first received Vedic knowledge within the heart?
questions.feedback: The text states that Vedic knowledge was first imparted into the heart of Brahmaji, the original living being.

questions.prompt: 4. SB 1.1.2 says the Bhagavata Purana completely rejects which type of religion?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.2 explicitly rejects religious activities that are materially motivated, and presents the highest truth.

questions.prompt: 5. SB 1.1.2 says this highest truth is understandable by which kind of devotees?
questions.feedback: The verse says the highest truth is understandable by devotees who are fully pure in heart.

questions.prompt: 6. According to SB 1.1.2, what happens when one attentively and submissively hears Bhagavatam?
choices: The Supreme Lord is established within the heart
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.2 states that attentive, submissive hearing establishes the Supreme Lord within the heart.

questions.prompt: 7. SB 1.1.3 describes Srimad-Bhagavatam as what metaphor?
choices: The mature fruit of the desire tree of Vedic literatures
questions.feedback: The verse calls Bhagavatam the mature fruit of the desire tree of Vedic literatures.

questions.prompt: 8. In SB 1.1.3, why is this 'fruit' said to be even more tasteful?
choices: Because it is written in poetic meter
Because it emanated from the lips of Sri Sukadeva Gosvami
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.3 says it became even more tasteful because it emanated from the lips of Sri Sukadeva Gosvami.

questions.prompt: 9. In SB 1.1.4, where do the great sages assemble?
questions.feedback: The sages, headed by Saunaka, assemble in the forest of Naimisaranya.

questions.prompt: 10. SB 1.1.4 states the sages assembled to perform what kind of sacrifice, and for what purpose?
choices: Thousand-year sacrifice, for the satisfaction of the Lord and His devotees
Fire sacrifice, for victory in war
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.4 mentions a great thousand-year sacrifice performed for the satisfaction of the Lord and His devotees.

questions.prompt: 11. In SB 1.1.5, after offering Suta Gosvami a seat of esteem, what do the sages do?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.5 says they make inquiries with great respect after honoring Suta Gosvami.

questions.prompt: 12. In SB 1.1.6, the sages praise Suta Gosvami as being well versed in which set of texts?
choices: Scriptures famous for religious life, plus Puranas and histories
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.6 says Suta is well versed in religious scriptures, the Puranas, and the histories.

questions.prompt: 13. SB 1.1.6 notes Suta studied these texts under what condition?
questions.feedback: The verse says he went through them under proper guidance (a key principle of authorized learning).

questions.prompt: 14. According to SB 1.1.7, Suta is acquainted with the knowledge of Vyasadeva because Vyasadeva is described as:
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.7 calls Vyasadeva an incarnation of Godhead.

questions.prompt: 15. In SB 1.1.8, what personal quality is highlighted as a reason Suta can speak scientifically?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.8 says that because Suta is submissive, his spiritual masters endowed him with their favors, enabling him to speak scientifically.

questions.prompt: 16. In SB 1.1.9, the sages ask Suta to explain what he has ascertained as what for people in general?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.9 asks for the absolute and ultimate good (the highest welfare).

questions.prompt: 17. SB 1.1.10 lists several Kali-yuga traits. Which set matches the verse?
choices: Quarrelsome, lazy, misguided, unlucky, always disturbed
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.10 describes people in Kali as short-lived, quarrelsome, lazy, misguided, unlucky, and always disturbed.

questions.prompt: 18. In SB 1.1.11, why do the sages ask Suta to select the essence of all scriptures?
choices: Because duties are many and require many years of study
Because scriptures contradict each other completely
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.11 says there are many scriptures and duties, learned only after many years; therefore the essence should be selected for all living beings.

questions.prompt: 19. In SB 1.1.12, the sages say Suta knows the purpose of the Lord's appearance in the womb of Devaki as whose son?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.12 identifies the Lord appearing in Devaki's womb as the son of Vasudeva.

questions.prompt: 20. SB 1.1.13 requests that Suta explain teachings imparted by whom?
questions.feedback: The sages request teachings imparted by previous masters (acaryas).

questions.prompt: 21. According to SB 1.1.13, one is uplifted in which two ways by these teachings?
questions.feedback: The verse states one is uplifted both by speaking them and by hearing them.

questions.prompt: 22. SB 1.1.14 says living beings entangled in birth and death can be freed immediately by what act?
choices: Unconsciously chanting the holy name of Krishna
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.14 says even unconscious chanting of Krishna's holy name can free one immediately from the meshes of birth and death.

questions.prompt: 23. In SB 1.1.15, who is said to sanctify more quickly: pure devotees or the Ganges?
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.15 says great sages who have taken shelter of the Lord's lotus feet can sanctify at once, whereas the Ganges sanctifies after prolonged use.

questions.prompt: 24. SB 1.1.16 asks who, desiring deliverance from Kali-yuga vices, would be unwilling to do what?
choices: Hear the virtuous glories of the Lord
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.16 challenges the reader: who would not want to hear the virtuous glories of the Lord to be delivered from Kali's vices?

questions.prompt: 25. In SB 1.1.23, the sages ask that since Sri Krishna has departed, to whom have religious principles gone for shelter?
choices: To whom dharma has now taken shelter
To the kings of the earth
questions.feedback: SB 1.1.23 asks where religious principles have gone for shelter after Krishna's departure to His own abode.
